column2: marshap, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: No one, neither the doctor nor the pharmacist, told me to avoid spraying this medicine toward my septum. And after only two months of usage, and not even as much as the prescription called for, I have a hole in my septum. I am undergoing surgery to correct what has been a constant problem for me for two years. The surgery will be horrible. This medicine should have a HUGE warning on the box, advising users of the risk of a perforated septum.

column9: I use Nasacort (2 sprays each nostril) daily.  The first couple of weeks I took this, it seemed to help. But lately I can't tell the difference from before I started using it. I've tried other corticosteroid nasal sprays and at least this one doesn't give me thrush like some of the others did.  I guess that's the best thing about this one.  I'm not saying it's terrible and I'm not saying it's great. I'd give it a "meh."

column1: Chronic Inflammation of the Nose Not due to Allergies
column2: Firebrand, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Bad Head Pain!! I had chronic headaches while using this med. At first I had some light headed feeling so I reduced the dose to 1 spray in each nostril daily. The headaches started 3 months into using. The pain was all over my face, These were not like regular headaches, they were wierd pains in my head. It was so bad I was eating Advil like crazy.This went on for 3 months until I finally stopped using. It has been almost 2 weeks and the headaches are gone.I feel almost like normal before I started using this.I gave this a higher rating because of effectiveness, but at a terrible price, I was miserable! It seemed like I was in constant pain. I did some research and disovered that this is a common side effect of steroid nasal sprays. Steroids are nasty! be careful. If any doctor tells you it isn't absorbed ino the bloodstream, don't believe it!

column9: I have severe allergies and the doc put me on this spray. I have had headaches, scratchy throat, fatigue, and my nasal symptoms worsened. I found out it can cause candida of the nose and throat,mouth. I am severely allergic to mold and fungus. Now I will not use this again. If it causes candida then it wouldn't do me any good and would make it worse. I don't understand why a doctor would have a person with severe mold and fungus allergies even use this stuff. I wing as also suffering from excessive bleeding and lots of fatigue. I didn't know the side affects and that is my fault. I will carefully review any meds I am given from now on!! Oh and I am feeling much better already after 24 hours of not using this medication. Make sure you read the side affects of anything you take.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy

column9: I am going to try this medication soon, I went to ear, nose, throat specialist and he told me my nose (due to year round allergies) looked like baby with diaper rash. He did give good instructions on how to use it (because it will irritate your throat, etc)1) Drink some water first (to help with throat irritation)2) Use a salt water over the counter spray in each nostril3) Blow your nose very hard4) 2 squirts of Nasacort AQ in each nostril5) Drink some water again.

column9: I tend to suffer from sinus infections because something about the shape of my sinuses doesn't allow for proper drainage, thus the bacterial buildup & resulting infection. I know the literature says it doesn't work immediately, but I get quick results. Can't really talk about side effects because I don't use it daily. If you have allergies that cause sinus complications, give it a try!
